snippet: The House campaign that led to a federal investigation that has put scrutiny on John G. Rowland included allegations of impropriety in both major parties.
abstract: John G Rowland, former Connecticut governor who resigned in 2004 in campaign scandal, is part of new federal investigation into improper campaign financing that casts new light on 2012 race for a seat in Congress; Democrat Elizabeth Esty won the race for the seat, which Rowland, a Republican, had himself occupied for three terms, but allegations of impropriety in both parties had winnowed the field.
lead_paragraph: The House campaign that led to a federal investigation that has put scrutiny on John G. Rowland included allegations of impropriety in both major parties.

headline.main: Inquiry Implicating Rowland, Ex-Connecticut Governor, Offers Look at a 2012 Race
headline.print_headline: Inquiry That Implicates Former Governor Recalls Bruising Race for House
